segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection portal overview
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection portal overview

segment.source: Use the Windows Defender ATP portal to monitor your enterprise network and assist in responding to alerts to potential advanced persistent threat (APT) activity or data breaches.
segment.target: Use the Windows Defender ATP portal to monitor your enterprise network and assist in responding to alerts to potential advanced persistent threat (APT) activity or data breaches.

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection portal overview
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection portal overview

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: Enterprise security teams can use the Windows Defender ATP portal to monitor and assist in responding to alerts of potential advanced persistent threat (APT) activity or data breaches.
segment.target: Enterprise security teams can use the Windows Defender ATP portal to monitor and assist in responding to alerts of potential advanced persistent threat (APT) activity or data breaches.

segment.source: You can use the Windows Defender ATP portal to:
segment.target: You can use the Windows Defender ATP portal to:

segment.source: View, sort, and triage alerts from your endpoints
segment.target: View, sort, and triage alerts from your endpoints

segment.source: Search for more information on observed indicators such as files and IP Addresses
segment.target: Search for more information on observed indicators such as files and IP Addresses

segment.source: Change Windows Defender ATP settings, including time zone and alert suppression rules
segment.target: Change Windows Defender ATP settings, including time zone and alert suppression rules

segment.source: Windows Defender ATP portal
segment.target: Windows Defender ATP portal

segment.source: When you open the portal, you’ll see the main areas of the application:
segment.target: When you open the portal, you’ll see the main areas of the application:

segment.source: (1) Settings
segment.target: (1) Settings

segment.source: (2) Navigation pane
segment.target: (2) Navigation pane

segment.source: (3) Main portal
segment.target: (3) Main portal

segment.source: (4) Search bar
segment.target: (4) Search bar

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection portal
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection portal

segment.source: Note Malware related detections will only appear if your endpoints are using Windows Defender as the default real-time protection antimalware product.
segment.target: Note Malware related detections will only appear if your endpoints are using Windows Defender as the default real-time protection antimalware product.

segment.source: You can navigate through the portal using the menu options available in all sections.
segment.target: You can navigate through the portal using the menu options available in all sections.

segment.source: Refer to the following table for a description of each section.
segment.target: Refer to the following table for a description of each section.

segment.source: Area
segment.target: Area

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: (1) Settings
segment.target: (1) Settings

segment.source: Provides access to configuration settings such as time zone, alert suppression rules, and license information.
segment.target: Provides access to configuration settings such as time zone, alert suppression rules, and license information.

segment.source: (2) Navigation pane
segment.target: (2) Navigation pane

segment.source: Use the navigation pane to move between the Dashboard, Alerts queue, Machines view, Preferences setup, and Client onboarding.
segment.target: Use the navigation pane to move between the Dashboard, Alerts queue, Machines view, Preferences setup, and Client onboarding.

segment.source: Dashboard
segment.target: Dashboard

segment.source: Provides clickable tiles that open detailed information on various alerts that have been detected in your organization.
segment.target: Provides clickable tiles that open detailed information on various alerts that have been detected in your organization.

segment.source: Alerts queue
segment.target: Alerts queue

segment.source: Enables you to view separate queues of new, in progress, and resolved alerts.
segment.target: Enables you to view separate queues of new, in progress, and resolved alerts.

segment.source: Machines view
segment.target: Machines view

segment.source: Displays the list of machines that are onboarded to Windows Defender ATP, some information about them, and the corresponding number of alerts.
segment.target: Displays the list of machines that are onboarded to Windows Defender ATP, some information about them, and the corresponding number of alerts.

segment.source: Preferences setup
segment.target: Preferences setup

segment.source: Shows the settings you selected and lets you update your industry preferences and retention policy period.
segment.target: Shows the settings you selected and lets you update your industry preferences and retention policy period.

segment.source: Client onboarding
segment.target: Client onboarding

segment.source: Allows you to download the onboarding configuration package.
segment.target: Allows you to download the onboarding configuration package.

segment.source: (3) Main portal
segment.target: (3) Main portal

segment.source: Main area where you will see the different views such as the Dashboard, Alerts queue, and Machines view.
segment.target: Main area where you will see the different views such as the Dashboard, Alerts queue, and Machines view.

segment.source: (4) Search
segment.target: (4) Search

segment.source: Search for machines, files, external IP Addresses, or domains across endpoints.
segment.target: Search for machines, files, external IP Addresses, or domains across endpoints.

segment.source: The drop-down combo box allows you to select the entity type.
segment.target: The drop-down combo box allows you to select the entity type.

segment.source: Windows Defender ATP icons
segment.target: Windows Defender ATP icons

segment.source: The following table provides information on the icons used all throughout the portal:
segment.target: The following table provides information on the icons used all throughout the portal:

segment.source: Icon
segment.target: Icon

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Alert icon
segment.target: Alert icon

segment.source: Alert – Indication of an activity correlated with advanced attacks.
segment.target: Alert – Indication of an activity correlated with advanced attacks.

segment.source: Detection icon
segment.target: Detection icon

segment.source: Detection – Indication of a malware threat detection.
segment.target: Detection – Indication of a malware threat detection.

segment.source: Active threat icon
segment.target: Active threat icon

segment.source: Active threat – Threats actively executing at the time of detection.
segment.target: Active threat – Threats actively executing at the time of detection.

segment.source: Remediated icon
segment.target: Remediated icon

segment.source: Remediated – Threat removed from the machine
segment.target: Remediated – Threat removed from the machine

segment.source: Not remediated icon
segment.target: Not remediated icon

segment.source: Not remediated – Threat not removed from the machine.
segment.target: Not remediated – Threat not removed from the machine.

segment.source: Related topic
segment.target: Related topic

segment.source: Use the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection portal
segment.target: Use the Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection portal
